docs.lead_paragraph: The district attorney, Michael B. Nifong, said he believed that the accuser had become pregnant at least two weeks after the party.

headline.main: Duke Case Accuser Is Pregnant, and Test of Paternity Is Next
headline.print_headline: Duke Case Accuser Is Pregnant, and Test Of Paternity Is Next

docs.snippet: The district attorney, Michael B. Nifong, said he believed that the accuser had become pregnant at least two weeks after the party.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the White House briefing today, Tony Snow, the press secretary, was asked about comments President Bush made in an interview with People magazine about the pregnancy of his vice president's daughter, Mary Cheney, 37, who is expecting with her partner of 15 years, Heather Poe, 45.
docs.abstract: President Bush told People magazine he was very happy for Mary Cheney and her pregnancy.
docs.snippet: President Bush told People magazine he was very happy for Mary Cheney and her pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Garance Franke-Ruta, a senior editor at The American Prospect and a fellow at the Joan Shorenstein Center on the Press, Politics and Public Policy, takes to The Wall Street Journal to defend the oft-maligned "beauty industry" against its critics. "The beauty industry is not the problem; it is a part of the solution," she writes. "American women today are the victims of a more insidious idea, an idea that underlies the American obsession with self-esteem: the tyrannical ideal of 'natural beauty.' " She continues:
docs.abstract: Commentary on the "beauty industry," and how it empowers the average woman.
docs.snippet: Commentary on the "beauty industry," and how it empowers the average woman.
